main_definition: Employers refer to individuals, companies, or organizations that hire people to work under them.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Business owners who hire employees for their company.
meanings_and_examples.example: The employers of the small bakery needed additional staff during peak hours.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Legal entities responsible for providing jobs and managing employee relations.
meanings_and_examples.example: When an employee has a dispute with his/her workplace, they usually need to approach their employers.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Authorities or organizations that enforce labor laws and regulations.
meanings_and_examples.example: The government agency ensured that the employers complied with minimum wage requirements.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Companies that contract out work to other businesses for specific tasks.
meanings_and_examples.example: Many construction projects are completed by subcontractors working on behalf of major employers in the industry.
